com.camerontec.util.io.socket

Class AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.io.socket.AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The selectable channel reference type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer, SpinningSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer

    public abstract class AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
extends Object
implements SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
    Abstract base implementation of an SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer.

    This class handles:

    • The lifecycle of the single multiplexing thread using a NamedTaskExecutorService.
    • Registration and de-registration of channels.

    Subclasses must implement the following methods:

    • doClearRegistrations()
    • doRegistration(ChannelRegistration)
    • doDeregistration(ChannelRegistration)
    • doWakeup()
    • readableChannels()
    • readableChannelsProcessed()

    The lifecycle of this class and its subclasses is controlled via start() and stop(). Client code must call start() to schedule the multiplexer thread. Attempts to either start the multiplexer when it is already started or stop it when it is not started result in exceptions being thrown.

    See Also:
    start(), stop(), stop(long, TimeUnit)

      • AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer

        protected AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer(String taskName,
                                                   NamedTaskExecutorService executor)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of this multiplexer task. Must not be null or empty.
        executor - The task executor. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the thread name is null or empty or the CPU lock factory is null.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
        Start the multiplexer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the multiplexer is already started.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stop the multiplexer.

        An attempt is made to terminate the multiplexer thread by interrupting it and then awaiting its termination for the specified timeout. This does not guarantee that the worker thread will actually terminate - it may not if it does not respond to interrupts.

        All registrations are cleared.

        The multiplexer may subsequently be restarted via start(). All previous registrations must be reestablished.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the multiplexer is not currently started.

      • stop

        public final void stop(long timeout,
                       TimeUnit unit)
        Stop the multiplexer.

        An attempt is made to terminate the multiplexer thread by interrupting it and then awaiting its termination for the specified timeout. This does not guarantee that the worker thread will actually terminate - it may not if it does not respond to interrupts.

        All registrations are cleared.

        The multiplexer may subsequently be restarted via start(). All previous registrations must be reestablished.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout for awaiting termination of the worker thread. If a negative or zero value is supplied it is ignored and a default timeout is used.
        unit - The timeout unit. If a null value is supplied the default timeout is used.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the multiplexer is not currently started.

      • doClearRegistrations

        protected abstract void doClearRegistrations()
        Subclass specific hook for clearing any state associated with channel registrations.

        This method is guaranteed to be called exactly once after the worker thread is terminated.

      • register

        public final Future<Integer> register(String channelID,
                                      T channelReference,
                                      SelectableChannelReadProcessor<T> processor)
                               throws ClosedChannelException
        Description copied from interface: SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer
        Register a channel with the multiplexer.
        Specified by:
        register in interface SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
        Parameters:
        channelID - The channel ID. Must not be null or empty.
        channelReference - The channel reference. Must not be null. The referent channel must not be null, must be connected (if a connection oriented channel) and must either be configured as non-blocking or able to be configured as non-blocking.
        processor - The processor for handling bytes input via the referent channel. Must not be null. Must handle zero length reads (unless the concrete implementation guarantees that it will only callback when the channel is ready for reading) and partial reads. Must also attempt to complete as quickly as possible and never block, otherwise servicing of other channels will be disrupted.
        Returns:
        A future which can be used by the caller to await completion. Completion in this context means that the referent channel is now registered with the multiplexer. The result is the number of channels currently registered.
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - If the referent channel is closed.

      • doWakeup

        protected abstract void doWakeup()
        Wake up the multiplexer thread if it is currently blocked.

      • deregister

        public final Future<Integer> deregister(String channelID)
        Description copied from interface: SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer
        Deregister a channel from the multiplexer.
        Specified by:
        deregister in interface SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
        Parameters:
        channelID - The channel ID.
        Returns:
        A future which can be used by the caller to await completion. Completion in this context means that the specified channel is now de-registered from the multiplexer. The result is the number of channels currently registered.

      • readableChannels

        protected abstract boolean readableChannels()
        Return whether there are currently any readable channels.

        The concrete implementation may block the caller if necessary, however, it should attempt not to do so unless no channels are currently readable.

        Returns:
        True if there are currently any readable channels, false otherwise.

      • readableChannelsProcessed

        protected abstract void readableChannelsProcessed()
        Called when all readable channels have been processed.

        Designed to be used by sub-classes to clear down any post read state.

        Return the logger.

        The logger.
